results.title: Smacks and kicks
results.brief_description: A black comedy played out over a middle-class dining table. The weapons in this family war are choc wedges and mashed potato, indifference and lack of communication.

results.title: Slys = Slyss
results.brief_description: An unusual safety film without spoken commentary, tracing the complete story of one particular accident involving a young cyclist. We follow the ambulance over icy roads to the accident, the return journey to the hospital where examination, x-ray and operation take place. Only when the girl’s companion visits the hospital do we learn that carelessness was the cause.

results.title: Slum clearance in the thirties: the film evidence
results.brief_description: Critically examines documentaries, newsreels and propaganda films which dealt with pre-war public housing and slum clearances in Britain and assesses their reality. Includes postwar footage and a complete 1942 documentary about redevelopment made by the Ministry of Information ‘New Towns for Old’.

results.title: Slow death of desert water
results.creator_credit: Shelly Grossman and National Educational Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Vanishing Wilderness”.
Shows what is happening to Pyramid Lake, in Nevada, and its wild life because dams divert its source of water and sonic booms frighten its wild life. Based on the book “Our vanishing wilderness” by Mary Louise and Shelly Grossman and John Hamlet, 1969.

results.title: Slips,Trips and Falls
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
Along with manual handling, slips, trips, and falls are the cause of a majority of accidents in the workplace. This video covers everything from the ground up…leads on the floors, objects such as books and briefcases, slippery surfaces through to filing cabinets and reaching too far, taking short cuts and general good housekeeping practices.

results.title: Slippery slide
results.creator_credit: Damien Parer, Tasmanian Film Corporation and Donald Crombie
results.brief_description: A dramatised film examining the relevant life experiences of a boy and his sister who have gone through the “Welfare” system as neglected children, been given to foster parents, and eventually, through a series of incidents, end up in jail. Intended to help change attitudes towards welfare children and raise the consciousness of the community towards betterment of the child welfare system Cast includes Simon Burke; John Waters; Arkie Whitely.

results.title: Slip of the tongue
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and Bob Scarfe
results.brief_description: Considers the issue of speech problems in the classroom in terms of what type of problems are referrable to a speech pathologist. Presents teachers with a guide to what speech problems to look out for in the classroom. Describes language, articulation, voice and fluency.

results.title: Sling blade
results.creator_credit: Shooting Gallery, Brandon Rosser, David L. Bushell and Billy Bob Thornton
results.brief_description: Thornton stars as Karl Childers, a simple man who has spent the last 25 years in a mental institution for the murders of his mother and her lover. On the day he is to be released, Karl tells his story to two journalists and we learn the shocking circumstances surrounding the crime. Now out in the world, Karl experiences cruelty from some locals, kindness from others - especially a young boy and his mother, with whom he develops an unlikely friendship. However, when the mother’s abusive boyfriend appears on the scene, Karl is thrust into an explosive predicament that builds to a gripping, unexpected and unforgettable climax. Winner of the 1996 Academy Award for Best Adapted Screenplay.

results.title: Slime molds: plant, animal, or?
results.brief_description: This film illustrates some of the problems of classifying plants and animals by exploring the biological significance of slime molds: a case in point. The slime mold is suggestive at different times of both plants and animals. Docmented here are plasmodial movement and formation of spores.

results.title: Slima the dhowmaker: Tanzania
results.creator_credit: Paul Saltzman, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Sunrise Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
A Tanzanian teenager is apprenticed to a dhow-builder and learns skills unchanged for two thousand years. The film shows the building of a boat and the ceremony surrounding its launching.
